basics.name: Jack R. Featherstone
basics.headline: Upstate NY engineer focused on fullstack development, reliable services, and accessibility

experience.summary: Operate, maintain, and improve industrial equipment and packaging workflows.
highlights: Diagnosed conveyor, pneumatic, and electrical faults to reduce unplanned downtime during peak production windows.
Created repeatable service checklists and parts inspection that cut maintenance turnaround and onboarding time.
Collaborated with mechanics to tune processes for safety and throughput.

experience.summary: Prototyped and documented fabrication requests, pairing CAD work with light automation to deliver high quality designs.
highlights: Delivered small-batch signs on a two-week cadence by coordinating requirements with shop staff.
Used technical skills to reverse-image-search blurry drafts, find original copies, and deliver clean SVGs.
Operated CNC plasma cutter and replaced consumable components.
Experimented with new technologies to automate the creation of designs.

experience.role: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant, SER 321 (Distributed Software Systems)
experience.summary: Supplemental context not in the project anchors: supported distributed systems labs and documented debugging steps for students (no grading duties).
highlights: Published troubleshooting instructions for Linux & Java networking/threading labs so students could self-serve fixes.
Coordinated Slack Q&A and live office hours to keep students engaged and productive.

education.institution: Arizona State University, Ira A. Fulton Schools of Engineering
education.credential: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering
notes: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant for SER 321 (Distributed Software Systems).
Coursework in fullstack development, distributed systems, CAD, arduino, databases, and operating systems.

education.credential: Associate of Applied Science in Computer Science

notes: Graduated with Honors in Mathematics and Science.

timezone.label: UTC-5 (ET)
